page.title: 17OUR LOCAL NEWSPAPER
page.content: The Painswick Beacon is a local newspaper which was begun in 1978. The aim was to provide an opportunity for people to exchange information. It was founded by Terry Parker and Helen Horton, who formed a committee of eight people. The first edition was in April 1978, but they first met in January 1978. They were given expert advice on the layout, and first of all they use an ordinary typewriter, but now they use an electric typewriter, so that the print is not lighter or heavier in parts. There are usually from four to twelve pages produced on A4 size paper. Mr Parker, who has been Editor of the Beacon since the start, says that it is not really unique. Anyone can write something for the paper, and it is almost certain to appear.
